intro: Calytrix parvivallis, commonly known as the small-leaved hakea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters and is well adapted to dry conditions. Calytrix parvivallis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
